intro: Dendrocnide rechingeri, commonly known as the stinging tree, is a shrub or small tree native to northern Australia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many stinging plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, thorny foliage and produces small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves and stems contain irritant chemicals that cause severe skin reactions in humans. This plant thrives in tropical and subtropical environments, often found in rainforests and coastal areas.
